intro: Galium eruptivum, commonly known as the clustered bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and possesses a fibrous root system. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium eruptivum is often found in temperate regions of North America and is known for its ability to colonize disturbed soils.
